column1: #Text=~5,000 ) on south bank of the Danube River in the Wachau Valley of Lower Austria .
#Text=Melk marks the western terminus of the Wachau ( 86km west of Vienna ) and lies upstream ( 40km west ) from Krems .
#Text=, Linzer Straße 5 ( temporary location ; original site damaged during flooding ) , ☏ +43 2752-511 60 , ✉ melk@donau.com .
#Text=Free town map with a self-guided walking tour , a list of Melk hotels and rooms , latest info on nearby castles , bike rentals , and bike rides along the river .
#Text=Trains leave frequently from Vienna 's Westbahnhof to Melk , with two brief stops en route ( about 1 hr . trip time ) .
#Text=Use ÖBB 's SCOTTY to look up train information online .
#Text=Use the A1 Westautobahn motorway and take the exit Melk .
#Text=From mid-April through October Dürnstein can be reached by river boats which ply the route between Melk , Emmersdorf , Spitz , Dürnstein , and Krems /Stein .
#Text=Operates several times daily ; timetables and fares ( listed at the bottom of the page ) can be found here .
#Text=Tickets can be purchased at any of the docking points , in Vienna , or online .
#Text=Bicycles ( € 2 ) and dogs ( free ) permitted on board .
#Text=Operates twice daily , also making a stop in Weißenkirchen .
#Text=Timetables and fares can bee seen here .
#Text=Bicycles ( € 2 ) and dogs ( free , muzzle and leash required ) permitted on board .
#Text=Walking the small historic town center ( of mainly 16th-17th century buildings ) is easy ; takes about 10 minutes to traverse it .
#Text=The famous and huge 18th century Benetictine Abbey on top of a bluff forms a northern Baroque backdrop for the older town center and is accessed on its eastern side .
#Text=After registration ( online or by mobile ) , pick up a bicycle at any Nextbike location , and drop the bicycle off at the same or any other Nextbike spot .
#Text=A map of pickup and drop-off points can be found here ( click ' Wachau ' for Melk ) ; a brochure with map is available for download . €1/hr , €10/day .
#Text=( Benediktinerstift Melk ) , Abt-Berthold-Dietmayr-Straße 1 ( ticket booth on the south side , entrance at the east ) , ☏ +43 2752-555-232 , ✉ tours@stiftmelk.at .
#Text=May-Sep daily 09:00 - 17:30 ( last entrance at 17:00 ) ; Mar-Apr , Oct daily 09:00 - 16:30 ( last entrance at 16:00 ) ; Nov-Mar : guided tours only at 11:00 , 14:00 , ( German and English ) .
#Text=The abbey is built on a bluff overlooking the Danube River to the northwest and the town center to the south .
#Text=Most of the design of the present abbey ( a reconstruction started in 1702 ) was by the architect Jakob Prandtauer .
#Text=The 200m-long Kaisergang ( Imperial Corridor and Abbey Museum ) is decorated with portraits of Austrian rulers .
#Text=The Marmorsaal ( Marble Hall ) contains pilasters coated in red marble ; a richly painted allegorical picture on the ceiling is the work of Paul Troger .
#Text=The Bibliothek ( Library ) , rising two floors , again with a Troger ceiling , contains some 80,000 volumes .
#Text=The Stiftskirche ( Abbey Church ) , with its 200-ft dome and symmetrical twin towers , dominates the abbey complex and emphasizes its sacred purpose .
#Text=Damaged by fire in 1947 , the church is now almost completely restored , even to the gold-bullion gilding of statues and altars .
#Text=Originally designed as a Baroque park in 1750 , and replanted in 1822 as an English garden . € 4 ( adults ) , € 3 ( students ) , € 1 ( children 6-16 ) ; free with abbey admission .
#Text=( Alte Post / Altes Posthaus ) , Linzer Straße 3-5 , ☏ +432752 52307-112 .
#Text=Open only for special exhibits : Th - F 09:30 - 13:00 , Sa - Su 15:00 - 19:00 .
#Text=Built in 1792 by the Viennese architect Franz Wipplinger , the building now houses a collection of prehistoric artifacts from the region , as well as a photographic archive and library .
#Text=( Rathaus ) , Rathaus Platz 11 ( in the center of town ) .
#Text=Built in the 15th century , this is the oldest building in Melk .
#Text=The building is a private residence but can be appreciated from the outside .
#Text=The accordion was invented in Vienna in 1829 , and since then became popular around the world .
#Text=This private museum has 250 accordions , including some very rare and eccentric pieces , with the oldest dating from 1860 .
#Text=From April 1944 until liberation in April 1945 this site was a concentration camp , operated as a branch of the main camp in Mauthausen .
#Text=The former crematorium has been preserved as a memorial .
#Text=( Renaissanceschloss Schallaburg ) , Schallaburg 1 ( 5km south of Melk ) , ☏ +432754 6317-0 .
#Text=Apr-Oct M - F 09:00 - 17:00 , Sa Su and holidays 09:00 - 18:00 .
#Text=A well-preserved German Renaissance castle , on a site occupied since the Roman occupation ; the foundation dates to the Romanesque period .
#Text=Special architectural features include the courtyard with terracotta figures and the Renaissance garden .
#Text=The building is now a museum with specially-themed , annually rotating exhibits .
#Text=, gugler print & media , Auf der Schön 2 , Pielach , ☏ +432752500500 , ✉ office@gugler.at .
#Text=This graphic design agency hosts special solo artist exhibits three times a year from the contemporary Austrian art world .
#Text=Artists are selected by an independent jury .
